idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.1850

descript.abstract: Five of Charlotte's most significant older neighborhoods have been designated by City Council as Local Historic Districts, in recognition of their importance in the history and character of the city. The Historic District Commission and its staff work with property owners and businesses in the districts to assure that development and renovation occurs in a manner that is consistent with the character of the neighborhood.
descript.purpose: The purpose of a local historic district is to encourage the restoration, preservation, rehabilitation, and conservation of historically significant areas, structures, buildings, sites, and objects and their surroundings from potentially adverse influences which may cause the decline, decay, or total destruction of important historical, architectural, and archaeological features, which are a part of the city’s heritage, and to review new construction design to ensure compatibility with the character of the district.

idinfo.accconst: Requestor must contact Charlotte-Mecklenburg Planning Department to obtain latest data. The data should never be received by anyone other than the Charlotte-Mecklenburg Planning Department.
idinfo.useconst: Charlotte-Mecklenburg Planning Department shall not be held liable for any errors in these data. This includes omission, errors concerning the content of the data, and relative and positional accuracy of the data. These data cannot be construed to be a legal document. Primary sources from which these data were compiled must be consulted for verification of information contained in these data. These data cannot be resold in their present form.

dataIdInfo.idPurp: The purpose of a local historic district is to encourage the restoration, preservation, rehabilitation, and conservation of historically significant areas, structures, buildings, sites, and objects and their surroundings from potentially adverse influences which may cause the decline, decay, or total destruction of important historical, architectural, and archaeological features, which are a part of the city’s heritage, and to review new construction design to ensure compatibility with the character of the district.
dataIdInfo.idAbs: Five of Charlotte's most significant older neighborhoods have been designated by City Council as Local Historic Districts, in recognition of their importance in the history and character of the city. The Historic District Commission and its staff work with property owners and businesses in the districts to assure that development and renovation occurs in a manner that is consistent with the character of the neighborhood.
dataIdInfo.idCredit: Data is collected and maintained by The Charlotte Mecklenburg Planning Department.

Consts.useLimit: Although every effort has been made to ensure the accuracy of information, errors and conditions originating from physical sources used to develop the corporate database may be reflected in the data supplied. Users of this data must be aware of data conditions and bear responsibility for the appropriate use of the information with respect to possible errors, original map scale, collection methodology, currency of data, and other conditions specific to certain data. The City of Charlotte makes no warranty, either expressed or implied, as to the accuracy or completeness of any information archived and distributed.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata

altsys.altenc: Explicit elevation coordinate included with horizontal coordinates

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Area of feature in internal units squared.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.
